Message.Title: CY13 and CY14 estimates dropped again - every week they are nudged down by "in the tank analysts"
Message.Msg: This week's update: CY13 brought down 2c (to $1.29), CY14 brought down 5c to $3.20. CY14 P/E keeps going up on reduced growth expectations .. now up to 83.7 .... Longs: You are being frog-boiled as the slow erosion in estimates hides the changes and artifically keeps the price up (they don;t have to downgrade to the incremental changes each week), until their is a massive correction one day to make up the price difference.

Topic.Title: 52 week low now 212

Message.Msg: My favorite Chart I have developed (data from E*Trade): 2013 EPS FCT, Stock Price, 2013 FWD P/E Jan 2011 $5.75, $180.00, 31 Jan 2012 $3.20, $173.10, 54 Jan 2013 $1.76, $250.87, 143 Apr 2014 $1.48, $262.00, 177 Jun 2014 $1.29, $267.83, 208 So in 2011 when investors thought AMZM EPS was $5.75 they applied a 2-YR FWD P/E of 31 (reasonable) for a $180 stock price. Flash forward to today: CY13 EPS estimate has dropped by 78%, while the stock is up 49%. AMZN business now valued at 208x CY13 earnings (a 6x increase from 2 years ago). Let's look at this another way. Current analysts consensus CY15 EPS estimate is $6.70. Apply that same 31x 2-YR FWD P/E, and you get a target of $207.70 (22.5% decrease from yeaterday's close). The new 2-YR FWD P/E of 40.0 is being placed on company that is both growing slower and is much less profitable than it was in 2011. How do you think this will hold up in a market correction? AMZN has already been consolodating/distributing for the past 7 months while the market has been screaming .... My conclusion ... Look out below

Message.Title: Just Raised Dividend 100%! Insane!
Message.Msg: Wow, this is insane! Unbelievable news just came out from Concurrent (CCUR) that they are raising their quarterly cash dividend from $0.06 to $0.12 , an increase of 100%, with their next quarterly cash dividend being paid to shareholders this month! This equals an annual dividend of $0.48 and CCUR closed yesterday at an extremely undervalued $7.08! CCUR's dividend yield is now an insanely high 6.8%! CCUR's Mediahawk VX on demand video server technology just surpassed Cisco (CSCO)'s CDE 250 to become the #1 highest rated VOD product used by pay-TV companies, according to Current Analysis (industry leading unbiased review source)! Over the past 4 quarters, CCUR's operating profit has skyrocketed from $187,000 to $413,000 to $876,000 to $1,233,000 for HUGE growth of 559%! Last quarter, excluding share-based compensation and non-cash amortization, CCUR earned non-GAAP EPS of $0.16! This puts CCUR on track to earn non-GAAP EPS of $0.64 this calendar year! A P/E of just 20 to 30 based on potential full year non-GAAP EPS of $0.64 would make CCUR a $12.80 to $19.20 per share stock! CCUR's profits could continue to rapidly increase in the upcoming quarters with the recent signing of a HUGE contract with Virgin Media! CCUR's MediaHawk VX unified CDN solution will be used to support Virgin TV Anywhere, a new cloud-based entertainment service that gives customers the flexibility to enjoy their favorite TV content on computers, laptops, tablets and smartphones! CCUR could explode next week!

Topic.Title: The pumpers are out in force today

Message.Msg: Why would you make that guess? It's pretty obvious that this stock is disconnected from any fundamental logic you may have. Many times it goes with the market but some days it runs totally counter and often on less than incredible news. It seems like if they want to run it they can. They don't come out with earnings until probably late July so plenty of runway to move it around. I was kind of surprised the market went this nuts on today's report. By the times things get really ugly this could be well over $300. I agree with Greenspan as far as the Bernanke bucks. Things are not getting greatly better except for Wall street. Widows, Orphans, retiree's counting on returns are being forced into where they don't want to be. I'm glad at least one of the scams is acting mostly like it should based on it's fundies and that's CRM. AMZN is attractive compared to that scam.

Topic.Title: Sybs gave this pig one last kick ahead of the close

Message.Msg: The cartel can move this stock wherever they want, as evidenced by their constant early trading markup. The pattern is clear. As long as there is no broad selling that prevents their trading markup, they can manipulate this stock to whatever level they choose. This is supported by 85 billion a month. AMZN appears to be breaking out of it's 6 month, 265 option induced flatline. Why do you think this will unwind anytime soon? This game has been going on for over 3 years. Why will end next week?

Topic.Title: Sybs gave this pig one last kick ahead of the close

Message.Msg: AMZN has been very stable (and performing worse than the overall market) up to now. And that's despite all the hoopla over streaming, new phone, groceries, etc. So I would argue that this is just pushed up by the overall market today. What is slightly good news for the market is euphoria for AMZN. I look for a slight pullback next week (to 272). Then a little growth from there in the following weeks as the market anticipates AMZN earnings in July. I'll say she goes to 284 and then the earnings release hits. Down after that.

Topic.Title: Sybs gave this pig one last kick ahead of the close

Message.Msg: It won't. They can keep running it until there is some pressure not to or if a few huge investors run a campaign against Amazon. The best article I saw was a SA article which showed the last 3-5 years quarter by quarter, basically illustrating the horrible metrics trends and it wasn't one metric it was literally every metric except the most important one, the price of the stock. The stock has defied the metrics. That's some wild stuff and tells you exactly what you said, the cartel can move the stock wherever they want. Tread carefully.

Topic.Title: Sybs gave this pig one last kick ahead of the close

Message.Msg: Sybil: "Sybs gave this pig one last kick ahead of the close" Define "one last kick"? Did you mean it was your last shorting effort for today or did you mean your last shorting effort for your AMZN short position? In any case, do you now have 14,700 shares short (with today's addition of 500 shares)? And is your average short price now $268.49? Yesterday, it was $268.33. So, you have successfully raised the average price by a whopping 16 cents! You added more risk (over $136,565's worth of new shorts) to your position to increase your average price by 16 cents?

Topic.Title: Sybs gave this pig one last kick ahead of the close

Message.Msg: This is correct as long as the market is to remain at the all time high levels. This break out needs further market rally to survive. With many international market selling off and bond yield spiking, I'm seeing this as the last desperate attempt before the next decline. Today rally is the market is just a reaction to suck in more "dip buyers".

Message.Title: Daily short volume FINRA 6-7-13
Message.Msg: 822191 out of 1325426 shares traded on FINRA, 62% volume shorting vs 33% volume shorting from beginning of May. Since short shares outstanding is less than 2%, there is no short squeeze in play just bears placing bet near the all time high pricing with weakening fundamental.
